text: The A10, also called l’Aquitaine, is the longest autoroute (motorway) in France. It is about long. The autoroute goes from Paris to Bordeaux. It goes past Orleans and Tours. It first opened in 1960. It is part of the European routes E5, E50, E60, and E606. ==Exits and junctions== Junction number Destinations Notes A 6a north - Villejuif; Paris; Arcueil (E 5 north; E 15 north; E 50 east) northbound exit and southbound entrance A 6b north - Lille; Metz; Nancy; Rungis; Aéroport Orly; Créteil northbound exit (Rue de Kuhlman) and southbound entrance Massy; Longjumeau; Antony-Z.A.
